comments.commentBody: Mr Trump is a drowning fish. If someone as intelligent as Mr Obama was challenged by this conundrum. Mr Trump is a poster boy for overwhelmed.
Get real Sally.  Obama was a punk.

Let's hope cool heads prevail, who know that North Koreans want an intercontinental nuke because the U.S. and other adversary nations have them, possibly even sister country South Korea. To be insecure and crave a strike capability is not necessarily the same as intent to do so, for that is certain destruction. All you big children have to learn to play a brand new game.  That means everyone.

It takes two to tango or negotiate. If I am to accept the viewpoint of western media North Korea leader, Kim Jong-un, has not expressed any desire to engage in negotiations. What would motivate him to stop his countries arms buildup? What would it take for him to see a benefit of negotiating.
Iran and the Peoples Republic of China (PRC) may be the two most influential countries when it comes effecting a change in policy and I am not sure they have the desire or could even be successful. The Peoples Republic of China may be in the best position but what is the benefit for them to exert influence over North Korea.
I suspect our current administration will not keep a steady hand. Rather vacillating policy and blusterous outbursts which will only cause the situation to be exasperated. Probably a good time to revisit the definition of MAD, mutually assured destruction.
This problem has stumped professional diplomats and presidents of both parties.  People of high intellect and calm temprament.  And now, it's Donald Trump's turn.
Increasingly, spelling seems to "allude" everyone.

Agree. As a contrast, I remember the Kennedy / Khrushchev stand-off in the Cuban missile crisis. Now we have a TV celebrity and a N Korean leader who would probably be receiving mental treatment if he lived elsewhere. Kennedy was intelligent, well-read, sought the views of other leaders during crisis and firmly took a stand. What will Trump do?
An interesting aspect about the photo is that his entourage has note pads in their hands. Possibly the only place in the world where they wouldn't be holding smart phones.
We would have hacked the phones. So maybe they are not so foolish.

Mark, can they hack the kinds that you still have to crank?  If not, that's the one I want to go back to.  It's amazing what we once had, and sad that we let it slip through our fingers for a slick lie.
That's an intentional NK taunt. Their way of saying "hack this why don't you!" Their released photos are always carefully staged and edited for effect. No accidents allowed.
But they don't. And I doubt they will. After all, it was crystal clear during the campaign that he was unfit to be president. And still, the electoral college appointed him president.
Trump is a Twitter Tiger. Do something so this North Korean thug cannot have the ability to reach USA and harm our allies.

Why on earth didn't the US hire the Russian rocket experts at the collapse of the Soviet Union,instead of letting them move to N. Korea? It would have been far cheaper than what we will have to pay now.

The Gore Chernormydin commission was established in part to help Russia modernize, bring its industries up to western standards and to secure nuclear weapons and materials that might otherwise end up in hostile hands, though other cooperation programs also addressed those issues. But part of the agreement was that the us and its allies would not encourage a brain drain from Russia that would hamper their ability to modernize. So when their economy collapsed under Yeltsin many scientists and engineers lost their jobs and had to find new employers. Some went to work for Western companies setting up shop in Russia (cars, aerospace, IT, etc), but others found it more lucrative to move to countries that wanted highly specialized skills.

Mr Trump, pretend know-it-all,
His rise portends our Nation's fall,
What he says, what he means
Not worth a bag of beans
His dimwittery does appall.

Who knows if he means what he spouts,
Knows diplomacy's ins and outs,
An ego outsized.
Intellect despised,
Persistent purveyor of pouts.
Touché!

In order to be taken seriously, those of us opposing Trump would be better off opposing only serious matters.  I'm sure we could easily tie in the eating of steak as a sign of ignoring climate change and the environmental impact of livestock production, but the focus needs to be on policy plans, Russian ties, and tax returns.  Stay focused on those issues while eating those pork rinds, chicken enchiladas, grilled cheese sandwiches, and turkey chili like our past four presidents.

@joe in NJ - The organizations do not get gov't funding for abortions; that is illegal. Women need healthcare, pap-smears, pelvics, and contraception. There are fewer birth defects, untreated STDs and unplanned pregnancies (therefore, fewer abortions) when women have access to these services.

Oh, and aborted fetuses are not "sold." That too is illegal.

It's amazing the responses here show a variety of knowledge and understanding. The real issue is not what we know but the arrogant ignorance and lack of bandwidth of DT.  Maybe he will be at Mar-A-Lago and poll the members when the all comes?
Who needs a president whe we have the internet, right?

There's an important line between being an alarmist, and recognizing the true nature of an insecure and failing nation. A nation that wants a military capability already owned by their archenemy the U.S., by our ally and their sister state South Korea next door, by China, Russia, and many Western and other powers who oppose and hope to subvert N. Korea, or are seen as fellow underdogs. This is not meant as approval of or support for the N.K regime in any way. Do we want brinkmanship? Confrontation? They want the capability. Do they really want to use it and face certain annihilation?  HOW are we going to deal with it, for therein lies the threat.
Last sentences needs a citation.

So after 8 years of Obama and Hillary, NK is closer to nukes than ever before.  Surprise...oh, but wait....Obama warned Trump.....and Hillary had a memo.....so that means the Democrats have it all figured out, and we are doomed because of Trump's presidency.  Hmmm

Well mike, at least you have acknowledged that Obama and Clinton took the issue seriously and took serious steps to address the North Korean nuclear issue.  Meanwhile Trump's strategy seems to be summarized by him bellowing "not good" when asked about it.

Articles like this one are exactly the reason I subscribe to the Times.  It is refreshing to simply be told about the struggles which the powers of the world are involved in and the real issues of our time without getting the sense someone is trying to convince me of something and without having a good reason to believe the writer has a vested interest in the matter.
Hate to break it to you, but ALL of your ideas have been used for at least a decade.  To no effect.

That false paradigm doesn't take into account that SK has a vote in this issue, and neither Korea's wish to once again be a vassal of China, as they were for centuries.
The difference between SK/NK and the Germanys is like day and night.....and reunification is a wish neither of the Koreans or the Chinese.. NK has a starving, uneducated populace unlike E Germany, and their cultural differences have been magnified by generations of brainwashing in the North.....
Since SK will never green-light an attack of NK, and SK is so penetrated by chinese spies, there is no chance a secret attack would ever take place, so if a deal isn't made ( which, unfortunately offers an additional blueprint to other crackpots around the world), we will be stuck on defense until Kim decides to launch an emp/nuke against us and push our economy back 30 years

M...thank you for your reply and to Jeff too. Remember Vietnam and Iraq. Whenever we try to be the world's police person we only make things worse....big time..

Pakistan has nuclear weapons, despite the fact they have probably done more damage to us by hiding Bin Laden than North Korea has done. Russia can wipe us out with nuclear weapons and hacked into our election process. I don't think we should nuke them over it.

The point being is Pakistan or North Korea are not a nuclear threat to us. When and if they do then we respond forcefully.
typo on one of my posts...should read NOT nuke..
You're using elitist alternative facts.  Unfair!
Trump will discuss this issue while dining at Mar a Logo!

There is only one way and that is military intervention. US should do whatever is in its power to crash this regime and unite it with the South as a favour to its poor people.

If Chinese wants to stand on the way and be responsible for a nuclear catastrophe, then the world should isolate China as a rogue nation just like North Korea. They should choose which side they will stand on...

That killing with nerve gas should come as a warning to everyone!
